intro: Bredia omeiensis, commonly known as the Guangdong hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to southern China. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows as an upright shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters, with palmately lobed leaves. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for gardens and landscapes. Bredia omeiensis is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local pollinators.
